user.README.md:
# Welcome to the Portfolio Terminal

This terminal interface allows you to explore content using Linux commands.

Type `help` to see available commands.
Use `ls` to list directories.
Use `cd` to change directories.
Use `cat` to read files.

Try exploring the projects/ and blogs/ directories to see content.

about.bio.txt:
Frontend developer with a passion for minimal design and user experience. I create web applications that balance form and function, with special attention to performance and accessibility.

My work focuses on building interfaces that are both visually appealing and highly functional, always prioritizing the end user's needs.

When not coding, I enjoy exploring new technologies, writing about web development, and contributing to open source projects.

downloads.resume.pdf: [PDF CONTENT - Resume with professional experience and education details]

terminal-help.commands.txt:
AVAILABLE COMMANDS:

ls - List directory contents
cd - Change directory
pwd - Print working directory
cat - Concatenate and display file contents
echo - Display a line of text
clear - Clear the terminal screen
help - Display help information
find - Search for files
grep - Search for patterns in files
head - Display first lines of a file
tail - Display last lines of a file

Special shortcuts:
!! - Repeat the last command
terminal-help.examples.txt:
COMMAND EXAMPLES:

ls -l /home/user/projects
cd ~/blogs
pwd
cat README.md
echo "Hello World"
clear
help grep
find . -name "*.md"
grep "JavaScript" blogs/vanilla-js.md
head -n 5 about/bio.txt
tail -n 3 about/contact.txt

etc.motd:
Welcome to the Portfolio Terminal!
Type 'help' to see available commands.

This terminal emulator allows you to explore the portfolio using Linux-style commands.
Navigate to ~/projects to see development projects.
Navigate to ~/blogs to read articles.
